aimike002 wrote:
> 
> I think I've clarified my thinking on this now. As I see it
> I can just use the node numbers (rather than x-y cordinates) in the
> innovation table. Where a link with the same innov number has a
> different 'location' in two different genomes, the fitter of the
> two will prevail at crossover.

Hi Mike,

Sorry I didn't get back to you more quickly, but yes, that should work 
fine.  Maintaining XY positions of nodes is unnecessary complexity.

--Steve
